questions.question_text: An administrator is configuring posture assessment in Cisco ISE for the first time. Which two components must be uploaded to Cisco ISE to use Secure Client for the agent configuration in a client provisioning policy? (Choose two.)
Which Cisco ISE module contains a list of vendor names, product names, and attributes provided by OPSWAT?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
The compliance module contains a list of fields, such as vendor name, product version, product name, and attributes provided by OPSWAT that supports Cisco ISE posture conditions.
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/security/ise/2-2/admin_guide/b_ise_admin_guide_22/b_ise_admin_guide_22_chapter_010001.html#:~:text=The%20compliance%20module%20contains%20a,supports%20Cisco%20ISE%20posture%20conditions.

Selected Answer: A
Correct A
Compliance Module
The compliance module contains a list of fields, such as vendor name, product version, product name, and attributes provided by OPSWAT that supports Cisco ISE posture conditions. 
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/security/ise/3-1/admin_guide/b_ise_admin_3_1/b_ISE_admin_31_compliance.html#id_17065

Posture Checks (this one uses the library)
The ISE Posture module uses the OPSWAT v3 or v4 library to perform posture checks.
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/security/vpn_client/anyconnect/anyconnect44/administration/guide/b_AnyConnect_Administrator_Guide_4-4/configure-posture.html

Selected Answer: A
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/security/ise/3-1/admin_guide/b_ise_admin_3_1/b_ISE_admin_31_compliance.html.

Selected Answer: A
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/security/ise/3-0/admin_guide/b_ISE_admin_3_0/b_ISE_admin_30_compliance.html?bookSearch=true

Selected Answer: D
Posture module uses OPSWAT v3 library

questions.question_text: Which two statements are correct regarding the differences between RADIUS and TACACS+? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BC
B, C are the corrects answers

Selected Answer: BC
BC is correct
B and C

Selected Answer: BC
This is B and C.

Selected Answer: BC
BC are the correct answer
I think its B & C
is not correct

choices.A: RADIUS encrypts the entire packet, whereas TACACS+ only encrypts the password field.
choices.D: RADIUS uses TCP as the transmission protocol, whereas TACACS+ uses both UDP and TCP protocols.
choices.E: RADIUS supports full command logging, whereas TACACS+ does not provide any command logging.
choices.C: RADIUS combines the authentication and authorization functions, whereas TACACS+ separates them.
choices.B: RADIUS primary use is for network access, whereas TACACS+ primary use is for device administration.

questions.question_text: A new Cisco ISE infrastructure is being built to provide network access control. If Cisco Discovery Protocol is used, what information is being gathered in relation to profiling with Cisco ISE?

discussion.content:
Answer: B â€“ device ID
SISE ebook:
When querying a NAD, ISE looks for interface data (such as which interface or which VLAN), session data (if the interface is Ethernet), and Cisco Discovery Protocol (CDP) and Link Layer Discovery Protocol (LLDP) data (if these protocols are enabled). CDP and LLDP data can be very useful in identifying a device type by its registered capabilities and similar attributes.
Cisco ISE uses !!! SNMP !!! to query NAD for CDP and LLDP data.

Device sensor config for CDP usage:
---
Create a list for CDP and configure the device name, version type, capabilities type, and platform type, as demonstrated here:

CAT9300(config)#device-sensor filter-list cdp list <cdp_list_name>
CAT9300(config-sensor-cdplist)#tlv name device-name
CAT9300(config-sensor-cdplist)#tlv name platform-type
CAT9300(config-sensor-cdplist)#tlv name version-type
CAT9300(config-sensor-cdplist)#tlv name capabilities-type

Selected Answer: B
correct
this Q came out in my exam today but in full sentence.

Selected Answer: B
B is correct -- Configure Active Directory User Groups
You must configure Active Directory user groups for them to be available for use in authorization policies. Internally, Cisco ISE uses security identifiers (SIDs) to help resolve group name ambiguity issues and to enhance group mappings. SID provides accurate group assignment matching.

questions.question_text: When configuring Active Directory groups, what does the Cisco ISE use to resolve ambiguous group names?
